org.biopax.validator.api

Interface Rule<T>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CvRule<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRule

    public interface Rule<T>
    Validation rule interface. Although at run time T is a BioPAXElement (this is 100% true for the current version), at compile time, when implementing a rule, one may prefer to use other interfaces as well, e.g., Process or Named. Therefore, "T extends BioPAXElement" is not used here.
    Author:
    rodche

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Can check it?

    • Method Detail

      • check

        void check(org.biopax.validator.api.beans.Validation validation,
           T thing)
        Validates the object.
        Parameters:
        validation - the object where the model, validation settings and errors are stored
        thing - to validate

      • canCheck

        boolean canCheck(Object thing)
        Can check it?
        Parameters:
        thing - an object to validate
        Returns:
        True when this rule can check the object.

      • error

        void error(org.biopax.validator.api.beans.Validation validation,
           Object object,
           String code,
           boolean setFixed,
           Object... args)
        Saves the error or warning that occurred or was fixed. Call this method from a validation rule implementation every time after a problem is found and/or fixed.
        Parameters:
        validation - the object where the model, validation settings and errors are stored
        object - that is invalid or caused the error
        code - error code, e.g., 'illegal.value'
        setFixed - true/false - whether the issue was auto-fixed or not
        args - extra parameters for the error message template
